bibl.title: Hellenistic Aswan.
bibl.note: Excavations in Area 15 revealed an unfinished political monument of the time of Ptolemy III or IV and a luxurious bathing installation built on top of it earlier than 167 B.C., but abandoned before the end of the Ptolemaic period. While Hellenization as such failed, the process of urbanization was well under way at the advent of the Roman era.

bibl.title: The First Cataract of the Nile. One Region - Diverse Perspectives

bibl.seg: Dietrich Raue, Stephan J. Seidlmayer & Philipp Speiser (edd.), The First Cataract of the Nile. One Region - Diverse Perspectives = Deutsches Archäologisches Institut. Abteilung Kairo. Sonderschrift 36 (Berlin - Boston, 2013) pp. 123-133, 5 figg. et pll. 26-28.

Excavations in Area 15 revealed an unfinished political monument of the time of Ptolemy III or IV and a luxurious bathing installation built on top of it earlier than 167 B.C., but abandoned before the end of the Ptolemaic period. While Hellenization as such failed, the process of urbanization was well under way at the advent of the Roman era.
